text: In boolean algebra, DeMorgan's laws are the laws of how a NOT gate affects AND and OR statements: :\overline{A \cdot B} = \overline {A} + \overline {B} :\overline{A + B} = \overline {A} \cdot \overline {B} They can be remembered by "break the line, change the sign". == Truth tables == The following truth tables prove DeMorgan's laws. INPUT INPUT OUTPUT 1 OUTPUT 2 A B NOT (A AND B) (NOT A) OR (NOT B) 0 0 1 1 0 1 1 1 1 0 1 1 1 1 0 0 INPUT INPUT OUTPUT 1 OUTPUT 2 A B NOT (A OR B) (NOT A) AND (NOT B) 0 0 1 1 0 1 0 0 1 0 0 0 1 1 0 0 == References == Category:Boolean algebra Category:Logic gates
title: De Morgan's laws
